articles.headline: Barack Obama Takes On a New Role: Fighting Disinformation
articles.snippet: The former president has embarked on a campaign to warn that the scourge of online falsehoods has eroded the foundations of democracy.
articles.abstract: The former president has embarked on a campaign to warn that the scourge of online falsehoods has eroded the foundations of democracy.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In 2011, President Barack Obama swept into Silicon Valley and yukked it up with Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook’s founder. The occasion was a town hall with the social network’s employees that covered the burning issues of the day: taxes, health care, the promise of technology to solve the nation’s problems.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Cecilia Kang

articles.headline: A Ukrainian Town Goes Underground as Russia Assaults the East
articles.snippet: As Ukrainian forces dig into trenches and residents flee into basements, Russia’s artillery attacks have intensified. “They can’t get through the front lines and so they’re starting simply to destroy the city,” a Ukrainian official said.
articles.abstract: As Ukrainian forces dig into trenches and residents flee into basements, Russia’s artillery attacks have intensified. “They can’t get through the front lines and so they’re starting simply to destroy the city,” a Ukrainian official said.
articles.lead_paragraph: AVDIIVKA, Ukraine — Spartak Kyurdzhiev was bragging to friends on Wednesday that he never hides from bombings anymore when a volley of rocket fire landed with such intensity nearby that he dashed into the school he was standing in front of.

articles.headline: He Was a Penniless Donor to the Far Right. He Was Also a Russian Spy.
articles.snippet: An investigation in Slovakia has exposed how Russian clandestine operations are trying to sow discord in Europe and create sympathy for Moscow over Ukraine.
articles.abstract: An investigation in Slovakia has exposed how Russian clandestine operations are trying to sow discord in Europe and create sympathy for Moscow over Ukraine.
articles.lead_paragraph: KOSICE, Slovakia — He lived with his sick mother and never had a regular job. He had no obvious source of income and, according to his uncle, even signed up for welfare benefits as a caregiver deserving of state support.

articles.headline: Tesla’s profits jumped in the first quarter, but challenges loom.
articles.snippet: The electric carmaker had to close an important factory in Shanghai because of China’s efforts to stamp out a coronavirus outbreak.
articles.abstract: The electric carmaker had to close an important factory in Shanghai because of China’s efforts to stamp out a coronavirus outbreak.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tesla said on Wednesday that it made a $3.3 billion profit in the first three months of the year, up from $438 million a year earlier and the biggest quarterly profit since the company’s creation. But Tesla also said it expected its factories to run below capacity for the rest of 2022.

articles.headline: Netflix’s Stumble Could Be a Warning Sign for Streaming Industry
articles.snippet: The company faces a number of challenges, but its problems may be an indication that its competitors are racing toward an unstable future.
articles.abstract: The company faces a number of challenges, but its problems may be an indication that its competitors are racing toward an unstable future.
articles.lead_paragraph: Many entertainment executives, tired of playing catch-up to a Silicon Valley interloper, have been waiting for the comeuppance of Netflix. But this may not have been the way they hoped it would happen.
articles.byline: By John Koblin and Nicole Sperling

articles.headline: Justice Dept. Appeals to Reinstate Transportation Mask Mandate
articles.snippet: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention ruled the mandate “necessary,” but an appeal risks creating a precedent that could permanently constrain the agency.
articles.abstract: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention ruled the mandate “necessary,” but an appeal risks creating a precedent that could permanently constrain the agency.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Biden administration on Wednesday appealed a federal court ruling striking down the mask requirement for passengers on planes, trains, buses and other public transportation after the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention concluded that the mandate was “necessary” to protect the public from the spread of the coronavirus.

articles.headline: Warning Ukraine’s Friends to ‘Think Twice,’ Putin Tests Advanced Missile
articles.snippet: Vladimir Putin said Russia’s test-firing of its new I.C.B.M. sends a message, as his forces prepare for a broad offensive in eastern Ukraine.
articles.abstract: Vladimir Putin said Russia’s test-firing of its new I.C.B.M. sends a message, as his forces prepare for a broad offensive in eastern Ukraine.
articles.lead_paragraph: With a pointed warning to Ukraine’s Western allies, Russia test-launched a new intercontinental missile on Wednesday, even as it unleashed a hail of bombs, artillery and missiles inside Ukraine in a drive to weaken Ukrainian defenses for a major ground offensive in the east.
articles.byline: By Anton Troianovski and Richard Pérez-Peña

articles.headline: If Biden’s Plan Is Like a ‘New Deal,’ Why Don’t Voters Care?
articles.snippet: The $1.9 trillion pandemic-relief law unleashed a massive wave of spending on local construction projects and programs. Democratic candidates aren’t getting much credit.
articles.abstract: The $1.9 trillion pandemic-relief law unleashed a massive wave of spending on local construction projects and programs. Democratic candidates aren’t getting much credit.
articles.lead_paragraph: RICHMOND, Va. — As Chris Frelke surveyed the Thomas B. Smith Community Center, he conceded that the beige-and-green cinder block structure was not much to look at. But Mr. Frelke, the parks director in Virginia’s capital, spoke with excitement describing the image in his mind’s eye: One day, there would be a pristine new complex capable of providing services from child care to community college classes.

articles.headline: ‘I’ve Had It With This Guy’: G.O.P. Leaders Privately Blasted Trump After Jan. 6
articles.snippet: In the days after the attack, Representative Kevin McCarthy planned to tell Mr. Trump to resign. Senator Mitch McConnell told allies impeachment was warranted. But their fury faded fast.
articles.abstract: In the days after the attack, Representative Kevin McCarthy planned to tell Mr. Trump to resign. Senator Mitch McConnell told allies impeachment was warranted. But their fury faded fast.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the days after the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol building, the two top Republicans in Congress, Representative Kevin McCarthy and Senator Mitch McConnell, told associates they believed President Trump was responsible for inciting the deadly riot and vowed to drive him from politics.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: With sunken warship, Russian disinformation faces a test.
articles.snippet: Families of missing crew members say the Russian authorities are giving them the runaround after a flagship sank last week in the Black Sea.
articles.abstract: Families of missing crew members say the Russian authorities are giving them the runaround after a flagship sank last week in the Black Sea.
articles.lead_paragraph: Families whose sons were listed as missing after the Russian flagship in the Black Sea sank a week ago are demanding answers in increasing numbers as the Ministry of Defense and top government officials stay silent about the fate of the crew.
articles.byline: By Neil MacFarquhar and Alina Lobzina

articles.headline: Air Travel Is Back. Now the Airlines Have to Keep Up.
articles.snippet: American, United and Delta are gearing up for a flood of bookings. But the industry faces constraints in taking full advantage of the demand.
articles.abstract: American, United and Delta are gearing up for a flood of bookings. But the industry faces constraints in taking full advantage of the demand.
articles.lead_paragraph: Air travel is back. Can the industry keep up?

articles.headline: Elon Musk details his plan to pay for a $46.5 billion takeover of Twitter.
articles.snippet: Mr. Musk has been building a stake in the social media company and last week made an unsolicited offer to acquire it outright.
articles.abstract: Mr. Musk has been building a stake in the social media company and last week made an unsolicited offer to acquire it outright.
articles.lead_paragraph: Elon Musk said on Thursday that he had commitments worth $46.5 billion to finance his proposed bid for Twitter and was exploring whether to launch a hostile takeover for the social media company.

articles.headline: How a Crime-Fighting Institution Took a Partisan Turn
articles.snippet: Crime Stoppers of Houston built its reputation on a successful tip line. Then it decided to take on Democratic judges.
articles.abstract: Crime Stoppers of Houston built its reputation on a successful tip line. Then it decided to take on Democratic judges.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — “Anyone with information is urged to call Crime Stoppers at 713-222-TIPS.” That message, along with the promise of a reward, has appeared for decades at the end of news reports about shootings, stabbings or criminal mayhem in the nation’s fourth-largest city.
articles.byline: By David A. Fahrenthold and Keri Blakinger

articles.headline: CNN+ Streaming Service Will Shut Down Weeks After Its Start
articles.snippet: A major investment by CNN, which poached big-name anchors and threw a splashy launch party, ends abruptly at the hands of a new corporate leadership team.
articles.abstract: A major investment by CNN, which poached big-name anchors and threw a splashy launch party, ends abruptly at the hands of a new corporate leadership team.
articles.lead_paragraph: At sunset on the last Monday of March, CNN stars gathered for a gala on the 101st floor of a Midtown Manhattan skyscraper to celebrate the launch of CNN+, the streaming service that was supposed to take the network into the digital future.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum, John Koblin and Benjamin Mullin
